Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: காணாதான் காட்டுவான் தான்காணான் காணாதான் கண்டானாம் தான்கண்ட வாறு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: One who would teach a fool will (simply) betray his folly; and the fool would (still) think himself 'wise in his own conceit'.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A wise teacher is trying to show an ignorant person a beautiful, complex, and true vision of the world.
Layered_Composition.Midground: The ignorant person, who cannot see this true vision ('காணாதான்'), is nonetheless confidently explaining his own, completely wrong and simplistic version of reality. His version is a childish, crayon drawing compared to the teacher's masterpiece.
Layered_Composition.Background: The ultimate folly is that the ignorant person is completely convinced that their own childish drawing is the true and correct one ('கண்டானாம் தான்கண்டவாறு'), and they are trying to 'teach' the teacher.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The futility of trying to teach one who cannot see: they will not see the teacher's vision, and will instead be confirmed in their own ignorant view.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The contrast between the teacher's true, complex vision and the fool's simplistic, wrong 'vision' (the crayon drawing) is the core of the image. The fool's confident expression while holding his bad drawing is key.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Ironic, futile, a communication breakdown, arrogant ignorance.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The teacher's vision is full of rich detail and beautiful light. The fool's drawing is crude, with flat, garish colors. The fool is lit by the misplaced confidence of his own delusion.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that shows the two competing visions, with a focus on the fool's unshakable, misplaced confidence.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a strong stylistic contrast between the two 'visions'.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Lighting that reflects the quality of the two visions.

Cultural_Anchors: Thinks he has seen, according to his own sight.
The impossibility of teaching the willfully ignorant.
